title: Dementia Evaluation
scope: ** Systematic evaluation of cognitive impairment and dementia in adults. Covers comprehensive workup to identify reversible causes and establish etiology. Includes initiation of symptomatic treatment. Excludes pediatric intellectual disability, acute delirium (separate entity), and rapidly progressive dementia (separate template for urgent workup).

Extended Workup (Second-line).rationale: Elevated levels associated with dementia risk

Specialized Testing (Selected Patients).rationale: Subacute onset, smoking history, cancer history

Essential/First-line.target: Atrophy pattern, vascular changes, masses, NPH

Extended.timing: If mass, infection, or inflammation suspected
Distinguish AD from FTD; atypical presentations
Extended.target: AD: temporoparietal hypometabolism; FTD: frontal hypometabolism
Positive in AD and preclinical AD

Extended.timing: If parkinsonian features; DLB vs AD
Extended.target: Reduced in DLB; normal in AD

Extended.timing: If REM sleep behavior disorder suspected (DLB)
Diagnostic uncertainty, MCI vs dementia, baseline, disability evaluation

dosing.instructions: 1000 mcg IM daily × 7 days, then weekly × 4, then monthly; OR oral 1000-2000 mcg daily
Start 25-50 mcg daily; titrate per TSH
500 mg IV TID × 3 days, then 250 mg IV daily × 5 days, then 100 mg PO daily
Diagnostic LP removing 30-50 mL CSF; assess gait before/after
Neurosurgical placement
SSRI (sertraline 25-50 mg, escitalopram 5-10 mg)
Stop anticholinergics, sedatives, opioids
Start 5 mg QHS × 4-6 weeks, then increase to 10 mg QHS; 23 mg available for moderate-severe
Start 4.6 mg/24h patch; increase monthly to 9.5-13.3 mg/24h
Start 1.5 mg BID with food; titrate to 6 mg BID

Alzheimer's Disease - Cholinesterase Inh.monitoring: GI side effects more common than patch

dosing.instructions: Start 4 mg BID with food × 4 weeks; titrate to 8-12 mg BID; ER: 8 mg daily to 24 mg daily
Start 5 mg daily; increase by 5 mg/week to 10 mg BID
Start 7 mg daily; increase weekly to 28 mg daily
For patients on both; 7/10 mg to 28/10 mg daily
10 mg/kg IV q2 weeks; confirm amyloid-positive before starting

Alzheimer's Disease - Disease-Modifying.monitoring: MRI at baseline, week 6, 12; ARIA monitoring

dosing.instructions: 700 mg IV q4 weeks × 3, then 1400 mg q4 weeks until amyloid clearance; discontinue when cleared
Titration from 1-10 mg/kg IV q4 weeks; limited use
Music therapy, validation therapy, redirection, environmental modification
Start 25 mg daily; target 50-100 mg
Start 10 mg daily; max 20 mg (QT risk at higher doses)
25-100 mg QHS
7.5-15 mg QHS
12.5-100 mg QHS; lowest effective dose

Behavioral and Psychological Symptoms of.monitoring: Black box: increased mortality in dementia

dosing.instructions: 0.25-1 mg BID; lowest effective dose
34 mg daily
1 capsule daily × 7 days, then BID; for pseudobulbar affect
100-400 mg BID
81 mg daily; secondary prevention
Per cardiovascular guidelines
Target <130/80 per guidelines
Start low 25/100 TID; titrate cautiously
Contraindicated in DLB due to severe sensitivity
Can cause severe parkinsonism, NMS-like reaction; if needed, quetiapine safest

Referrals & Consults.indication: All patients with dementia for diagnosis confirmation and management
MCI vs dementia distinction, pattern analysis, baseline assessment
Goals of care, symptom management in advanced dementia
Power of attorney, healthcare proxy, estate planning

Patient/Family Instructions.item: Dementia is a progressive condition; treatments can help symptoms but not cure
Establish healthcare proxy and advance directives early while patient can participate
Home safety: remove rugs, improve lighting, stove safety, medication management
Driving assessment needed; may need to stop driving
Caregiver support is essential; respite care, support groups (Alzheimer's Association)
Medical alert bracelet, GPS tracking if wandering risk
Maintain routines, social engagement, cognitive stimulation
Return to ED if: sudden worsening, new weakness, fever, falls, inability to care for self

Lifestyle & Prevention.item: Cardiovascular risk factor management (BP, diabetes, cholesterol)
Hearing aids if hearing impaired (hearing loss increases dementia risk)

differential.features: Acute onset, fluctuating, inattention, often reversible cause
Depressed mood, "I don't know" responses, rapid onset, prior psychiatric history
Macrocytic anemia, neuropathy, subacute combined degeneration

differential.tests: History, thiamine trial, MRI (mammillary body changes)
MRI (cortical ribboning), EEG (periodic complexes), CSF RT-QuIC

evidence.recommendation: B12, TSH, metabolic panel in all patients
Lecanemab slows cognitive decline in early AD
evidence.source: [Clarity AD trial (van Dyck et al., NEJM 2023)](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/36449413/); FDA approved 2023

evidence.recommendation: Donanemab slows decline in early AD
CSF biomarkers (Aβ42, tau, p-tau) support AD diagnosis
Amyloid PET useful for diagnostic uncertainty

disposition.criteria: Most patients; mild-moderate symptoms, safe home environment, caregiver present
Acute behavioral crisis, unable to care for self, unsafe home environment, need for IV therapies, rapid progression needing urgent workup
Reversible causes treated, behavior stable, safe disposition, follow-up arranged
Unable to live independently, unsafe with current support level
Advanced dementia, 24-hour care needs, complex medical needs
End-stage dementia, FAST stage 7, goals of care focused on comfort
